sentences.en: Above all, the warfare of Hester's spirit at that epoch was perpetuated in Pearl.
sentences.cn: 而最主要的是, 当时海丝特的好斗精神也永远注入了珠儿的身心.

sentences.en: Aloscience, logic and mathematics included, is a function of the epoch.
sentences.cn: 所有科学, 包括逻辑学和数学在内, 都是有关时代的函数.

sentences.en: But that also makes his book one of the few epoch - making works of our time.
sentences.cn: 然而也正因为如此,他这本书才成为今日 划时代 的少数著作之一.

sentences.en: But, up to that epoch of my life, I had lived in vain.
sentences.cn: 不过, 直到我生命的那一刻为止, 我都白活了.

sentences.en: Duhuangling gold deposit occurred within the quartz diorite of Late Yanshan Epoch.
sentences.cn: 杜荒岭金矿床赋存于燕山晚期的石英闪长(斑)岩中.

sentences.en: His audience with the president was an epoch in his life.
sentences.cn: 他谒见总统是他一生中值得纪念的一件事.

sentences.en: How monogamy fares during this epoch, therefore, only occupies him very briefly.
sentences.cn: 所以, 他只是非常简单地论述了一下一夫一妻制在这一时期的命运.

sentences.en: I told him his idea was not exactly epoch - making.
sentences.cn: 我告诉他说他的思想算不上是划时代的.

sentences.en: It is our destiny to be alive during a renaissance epoch.
sentences.cn: 在复兴时期生存是我们的命运.

sentences.en: Mr Ryder resolved that this ball should mark an epoch in the social history of Groveland.
sentences.cn: 莱德先生决心使这场舞会成为格鲁佛兰德社交史上划时代的大事.

sentences.en: Paleocene The oldest epoch of the Tertiary, 65 - 55 million yesrs ago.
sentences.cn: 古新世:第三纪最古的年代, 6500万～5500万年前.

sentences.en: She wrung his hand and congratulated him on his epoch - making feat.
sentences.cn: 她紧握着他的手,祝贺他创造了 划时代 的功绩.

sentences.en: the beginning of a new epoch
The king’s death marked the end of an epoch.
sentences.cn: 这位国王的去世标志着一个时代的结束。

sentences.en: The mineralization epoch is the early period of mesoproterozoic Era.
sentences.cn: 成矿时代为中元古代早期.

sentences.en: This great bridge traverses the channel, which is of epoch - making significance.
sentences.cn: 这座大桥横越了海峡, 具有跨时代的意义.

sentences.en: Those embedded in gravel or sand would not endure to a distant epoch.
sentences.cn: 那些被沙砾所埋藏的,也不能保存到久远时代.
